Here is the modified document:

∑K
i=1 n^2_i
N \overline{\sigma}_2
AI(θ)

Let C = U - L, where L, U are the lower bound and upper bound of θ respectively (see Definition 1), and let n = max{n_1, n_2, ..., n_K}. Then for any ϵ > 0, we have:

Prob{|u(θ) - \hat{u}_{SN}(θ)| ≥ ϵ} ≤ exp(- Nϵ^2 / (2τ^2 θ + 2nCϵ/3)).

Proof. Define random variables x_{i,j} = u(θ) - f_θ(z_i, v_{i,j}), and define random variables X_i = ∑_{j=1}^{n_i} x_{i,j}. First we prove that X_1, ..., X_K satisfy the conditions in Lemma 3.

E[X_i] = ∑_{j=1}^{n_i} E[x_{i,j}] = ∑_{j=1}^{n_i} [u(θ) - E[f_θ(z_i, v_{i,j})]] = 0.

By Definition 1, Prob{L ≤ f_θ(z_i, v_{i,j}) ≤ U} = 1, it holds that L ≤ u(θ) ≤ U (since u(θ) = E[f_θ(z_i, v_{i,j})]). Thus we have Prob{|x_{i,j}| ≤ U - L} = 1 and ...

Note: I've made minor changes to the original text for formatting consistency, such as adding spaces between mathematical symbols and changing some indices from i=1 to ∑_{j=1}^{n_i}.
